0.text: sports have always been strongly connected with entertainment.

1.text: whether it was the olympic games in ancient greece, or the 2018 fifa world cup in russia, sport competitions never failed to concentrate the attention of a considerable number viewers.

2.text: despite the undoubtable success of sport events in entertaining the general public some people believe that watching is not worth the time.

3.text: first, viewing sports has long ago become a tradition in a vast amount of families.

4.text: it is a way of spending time together that suits both parents and children.

5.text: this is especially evident in the usa, where fathers take their children to baseball games, just like their parents used to take them.

6.text: moreover, usually many generations in a family a likely to support the same team as part of the tradition.

7.text: this bring them closer together and strengthens family relations.

8.text: in addition, for the majority of people interested in a certain sport it is the best way of taking first steps in mastering the sport itself.

9.text: obviously, if an athlete is performing on such a level to be apart of a televised sports event, they have enough expertise and experience.

10.text: which means watching them do their job can be of great help in learning about the sport and a way of perfecting your own abilities.

11.text: many great athletes learned their craft by watching their childhood idols.

12.text: for instance, lionel messi, one of the best football players that of recent times, has learned by watching the argentinian football legend diego maradona play.

13.text: in conclusion, i believe that watching sports is a great way of bringing people together and learning new skills, which means that the time spent is totally worth it.
